channel.title: Comments on: Re-Architecting a Firebase app to work with Node.js and MongoDB
channel.description: Knowing is different & Doing is different

item.description: Why am i getting a var p = Proxy.create({ TypeError: Proxy.create is not a function

item.title: By: Rodrigo Mantica
item.dc:creator: Rodrigo Mantica
item.description: I created a fork with a version for Ionic 3 (Angular 4). It's almost working, except for an issue with Observable being null after getting todos, so component can't access the data. But it is printing fine in the console.
item.content:encoded: I created a fork with a version for Ionic 3 (Angular 4). It’s almost working, except for an issue with Observable being null after getting todos, so component can’t access the data. But it is printing fine in the console.

item.title: By: William Vega
item.dc:creator: William Vega
item.description: Can this be done using loopback.js and strongloop arc?
item.content:encoded: Can this be done using loopback.js and strongloop arc?

item.title: By: Getulio Romão C. Jr
item.dc:creator: Getulio Romão C. Jr
item.description: You could just go with loopback since your backend needs most an API and you would have offline sync and real time.
item.content:encoded: You could just go with loopback since your backend needs most an API and you would have offline sync and real time.

item.title: By: wbarahona
item.dc:creator: wbarahona
item.description: Yes, I will keep in mind that, I just wanted a functional example to expand... I will report back any issues, thanks.
item.content:encoded: Yes, I will keep in mind that, I just wanted a functional example to expand… I will report back any issues, thanks.

item.title: By: Arvind Ravulavaru
item.dc:creator: Arvind Ravulavaru
item.description:
Thanks wbarahona. But do keep in mind that this setup is experimental. I have not used this setup in a live project, so use with caution.
Also, feel free report any issues and bottlenecks with this setup. We can probably enhance it.
Thanks.
item.content:encoded:
Thanks wbarahona. But do keep in mind that this setup is experimental. I have not used this setup in a live project, so use with caution.

Also, feel free report any issues and bottlenecks with this setup. We can probably enhance it.

Thanks.

item.title: By: wbarahona
item.dc:creator: wbarahona
item.description: This is simple and sweet, I followed the steps et voila it works, now I have a foundation on how to build a real time app, and detach from firebase sir. Many kudos for you from Honduras :)
item.content:encoded: This is simple and sweet, I followed the steps et voila it works, now I have a foundation on how to build a real time app, and detach from firebase sir. Many kudos for you from Honduras

item.title: By: Arvind Ravulavaru
item.dc:creator: Arvind Ravulavaru
item.description:
You can check out this post : /architecting-a-restful-node-js-app/ It shows how to manage jwt on the client side as well as creation on server side.
Let me know if you are looking for some other solution. Thanks.
item.content:encoded:
You can check out this post : /architecting-a-restful-node-js-app/ It shows how to manage jwt on the client side as well as creation on server side.

Let me know if you are looking for some other solution. Thanks.
